controller

Class AIPathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.AIPathFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AIPathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    AIPathFinder attempts to recursively traverse the game Map. The goal is to get from the given starting position to the nearest player location.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • traverse

        public java.awt.Point traverse(int currAIRow,
                               int currAICol,
                               int plyrRow,
                               int plyrCol,
                               int aiMovement)
        Attempts to recursively traverse the game map from the first given X & Y locations to the next pair.
        Parameters:
        currAIRow - row index of current location
        currAICol - column index of current location
        plyrRow - the plyr row
        plyrCol - the plyr col
        aiMovement - the ai movement
        Returns:
        true if the current location is 'near' the other

      • validPosition

        public boolean validPosition(int tgtRow,
                             int tgtCol)
        Determines if a specific location is valid. A valid location is one that is on the grid, is not blocked, and has not been TRIED.
        Parameters:
        tgtRow - the target row to be checked
        tgtCol - the target column to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the location is valid
